intro: Geissorhiza pappei, commonly known as the Natal orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout rhizome. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred petal that aids in pollination by specific insects. Geissorhiza pappei is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
